trans-unit.source: Hybrid Networking (Azure Architecture Patterns)
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Networking (Azure Architecture Patterns)

trans-unit.source: The Hybrid Networking pattern is part of the Infrastructure area, which is described extensively in the CPIF Architecture document.
trans-unit.target: The Hybrid Networking pattern is part of the Infrastructure area, which is described extensively in the CPIF Architecture document.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Networking (Azure Architecture Patterns)
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Networking (Azure Architecture Patterns)

trans-unit.source: The [Cloud Platform Integration Framework (CPIF)](azure-architectures-cpif-overview.md) provides workload integration guidance for onboarding applications into a Microsoft Cloud Solution.
trans-unit.target: The [Cloud Platform Integration Framework (CPIF)](azure-architectures-cpif-overview.md) provides workload integration guidance for onboarding applications into a Microsoft Cloud Solution.

trans-unit.source: CPIF describes how organizations, customers and partners should design and deploy Cloud-targeted workloads utilizing the hybrid cloud platform and management capabilities of Azure, System Center and Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: CPIF describes how organizations, customers and partners should design and deploy Cloud-targeted workloads utilizing the hybrid cloud platform and management capabilities of Azure, System Center and Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: The **Hybrid Networking** pattern is part of the **Infrastructure** area, which is described extensively in the CPIF Architecture document.
trans-unit.target: The **Hybrid Networking** pattern is part of the **Infrastructure** area, which is described extensively in the CPIF Architecture document.

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Networking
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Networking

trans-unit.source: The Hybrid Networking design pattern details the Azure features and services required to deliver network functionality that can provide predictable performance and high availability across geographic boundaries.
trans-unit.target: The Hybrid Networking design pattern details the Azure features and services required to deliver network functionality that can provide predictable performance and high availability across geographic boundaries.

trans-unit.source: A full list of Microsoft Azure regions and the services available within each is provided within the Microsoft Azure documentation site.
trans-unit.target: A full list of Microsoft Azure regions and the services available within each is provided within the Microsoft Azure documentation site.

trans-unit.source: This document provides an overview of Microsoft Azure networking capabilities for hybrid environments.
trans-unit.target: This document provides an overview of Microsoft Azure networking capabilities for hybrid environments.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Virtual Networking enables you to create logically isolated networks in Azure and securely connect them to your on-premises datacenter over the Internet or using a private network connection.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Virtual Networking enables you to create logically isolated networks in Azure and securely connect them to your on-premises datacenter over the Internet or using a private network connection.

trans-unit.source: In addition, individual client machines can connect to an isolated Azure network using an IPsec VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: In addition, individual client machines can connect to an isolated Azure network using an IPsec VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: The Hybrid Networking architecture pattern includes the following focus areas:
trans-unit.target: The Hybrid Networking architecture pattern includes the following focus areas:

trans-unit.source: Connecting on premises networks to Azure
trans-unit.target: Connecting on premises networks to Azure

trans-unit.source: Extending Azure virtual networks across regions
trans-unit.target: Extending Azure virtual networks across regions

trans-unit.source: Extending Azure virtual networks between subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Extending Azure virtual networks between subscriptions

trans-unit.source: Providing developers remote network access
trans-unit.target: Providing developers remote network access

trans-unit.source: Architectural Pattern Overview
trans-unit.target: Architectural Pattern Overview

trans-unit.source: The hybrid networking architecture pattern is complex due to the possible number of scenarios that can be created.
trans-unit.target: The hybrid networking architecture pattern is complex due to the possible number of scenarios that can be created.

trans-unit.source: This architectural pattern will focus on the following four scenarios:
trans-unit.target: This architectural pattern will focus on the following four scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Site-to-Site hybrid networking with Multi-hop virtual network routing within a single subscription and region
trans-unit.target: Site-to-Site hybrid networking with Multi-hop virtual network routing within a single subscription and region

trans-unit.source: Site-to-Site hybrid networking with multi-hop virtual network routing across subscriptions and regions
trans-unit.target: Site-to-Site hybrid networking with multi-hop virtual network routing across subscriptions and regions

trans-unit.source: ExpressRoute hybrid networking using MPLS connectivity
trans-unit.target: ExpressRoute hybrid networking using MPLS connectivity

trans-unit.source: ExpressRoute hybrid networking using IXP connectivity
trans-unit.target: ExpressRoute hybrid networking using IXP connectivity
